name: Ability Focus
summary: +2 bonus to DC for saving throws against a monsters special ability.

name: Acrobatic
summary: +2 bonus on Acrobatics and Fly checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on all Acrobatics and Fly skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at leaping, jumping, and flying.

name: Acrobatic Steps
summary: Ignore 20 feet of difficult terrain when you move

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you move, you may move through up to 15 feet of difficult terrain each round as if it were normal terrain. The effects of this feat stack with those provided by Nimble Moves (allowing you to move normally through a total of 20 feet of difficult terrain each round).

text.name: Info
text.text: You can easily move over and through obstacles.

name: Agile Maneuvers
summary: Use your Dex bonus when calculating your CMB

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You add your Dexterity bonus to your base attack bonus and size bonus when determining your Combat Maneuver Bonus instead of your Strength bonus.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You add your Strength bonus to your base attack bonus and size bonus when determining your Combat Maneuver Bonus.

text.name: Info
text.text: You've learned to use your quickness in place of brute force when performing combat maneuvers.

name: Alertness
summary: +2 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You often notice things that others might miss.

name: Alignment Channel
summary: Channel energy can heal or harm outsiders

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of the chosen alignment subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of the chosen alignment subtype, your channel energy has no effect on other creatures. The amount of damage healed or dealt and the DC to halve the damage is otherwise unchanged.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new alignment subtype. Whenever you channel energy, you must choose which type to effect.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose chaos, evil, good, or law. You can channel divine energy to affect outsiders that possess this subtype.

name: Animal Affinity
summary: +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Ride checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on all Handle Animal and Ride skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at working with animals and mounts.

name: Arcane Armor Mastery
summary: Reduce your arcane spell failure chance by 20%

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 20% for any spells you cast this round. This bonus replaces, and does not stack with, the bonus granted by Arcane Armor Training.

text.name: Info
text.text: You have mastered the ability to cast spells while wearing armor.

prereq: Arcane Armor Training, Armor Proficiency, Medium, caster level 7th

name: Arcane Armor Training
summary: Reduce your arcane spell failure chance by 10%

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 10% for any spells you cast this round.

text.name: Info
text.text: You have learned how to cast spells while wearing armor.

name: Arcane Strike
summary: +1 damage and weapons are considered magic

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a swift action, you can imbue your weapons with a fraction of your power. For 1 round, your weapons deal +1 damage and are treated as magic for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. For every five caster levels you possess, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.

text.name: Info
text.text: You draw upon your arcane power to enhance your weapons with magical energy.

name: Armor Proficiency, Heavy
summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing heavy armor

text.name: Benefit
text.text: See Armor Proficiency, Light.

text.name: Normal
text.text: See Armor Proficiency, Light.

text.name: Special
text.text: Fighters and paladins automatically have Heavy Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at wearing heavy armor.

prereq: Light Armor Proficiency, Medium Armor Proficiency.

name: Armor Proficiency, Light
summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing light armor

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the armor check penalty for that armor applies only to Dexterity- and Strength-based skill checks.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A character who is wearing armor with which he is not proficient applies its armor check penalty to attack rolls and to all skill checks that involve moving.

text.name: Special
text.text: All characters except monks, sorcerers, and wizards automatically have Light Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at wearing light armor.

name: Armor Proficiency, Medium
summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing medium armor

text.name: Benefit
text.text: See Armor Proficiency, Light.

text.name: Normal
text.text: See Armor Proficiency, Light.

text.name: Special
text.text: Barbarians, clerics, druids, fighters, paladins, and rangers automatically have Medium Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at wearing medium armor.

name: Athletic
summary: +2 bonus on Climb and Swim checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on Climb and Swim skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You possess inherent physical prowess.

name: Augment Summoning
summary: Summoned creatures gain +4 Str and Con

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Each creature you conjure with any summon spell gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength and Constitution for the duration of the spell that summoned it.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your summoned creatures are more powerful and robust.

name: Awesome Blow
summary: Knock an opponent 10 feet away and prone.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, the creature may perform an awesome blow combat maneuver. If the creature's maneuver succeeds against a corporeal opponent smaller than itself, its opponent takes damage (typically slam damage plus Strength bonus) and is knocked flying 10 feet in a direction of the attacking creature's choice and falls prone. The attacking creature can only push the opponent in a straight line, and the opponent can't move closer to the attacking creature than the square it started in. If an obstacle prevents the completion of the opponent's move, the opponent and the obstacle each take 1d6 points of damage, and the opponent is knocked prone in the space adjacent to the obstacle.

text.name: Info
text.text: This creature can send opponents flying.

prereq: Str 25, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, size Large or larger.

name: Bleeding Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target takes 2d6 bleed

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing or piercing weapon, your opponent takes 2d6 points of bleed damage each round on his turn, in addition to the damage dealt by the critical hit. Bleed damage can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal skill check or through any magical healing. The effects of this feat stack.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause opponents to bleed profusely.

name: Bleeding Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target takes 2d6 bleed

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing or piercing weapon, your opponent takes 2d6 points of bleed damage each round on his turn, in addition to the damage dealt by the critical hit. Bleed damage can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal skill check or through any magical healing. The effects of this feat stack.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause opponents to bleed profusely.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: In melee, every time you miss because of concealment (see Combat), you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit. An invisible attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible. The invisible attacker's bonuses do still apply for ranged attacks, however. You do not need to make Acrobatics skill checks to move at full speed while blinded.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Regular attack roll modifiers for invisible attackers trying to hit you apply, and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC. The speed reduction for darkness and poor visibility also applies.

text.name: Special
text.text: The Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at attacking opponents that you cannot clearly perceive.

name: Blinding Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is blinded

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent is permanently blinded. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to dazzled for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on creatures that do not rely on eyes for sight or creatures with more than two eyes (although multiple critical hits might cause blindness, at the GM's discretion). Blindness can be cured by heal, regenerate, remove blindness, or similar abilities.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits blind your opponents.

name: Blinding Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is blinded

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent is permanently blinded. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to dazzled for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on creatures that do not rely on eyes for sight or creatures with more than two eyes (although multiple critical hits might cause blindness, at the GM's discretion). Blindness can be cured by heal, regenerate, remove blindness, or similar abilities.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits blind your opponents.

name: Brew Potion
summary: Create magic potions

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create a potion of any 3rd-level or lower spell that you know and that targets one or more creatures. Brewing a potion takes 2 hours if its base price is 250 gp or less, otherwise brewing a potion takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. When you create a potion, you set the caster level, which must be sufficient to cast the spell in question and no higher than your own level. To brew a potion, you must use up raw materials costing one half this base price. When you create a potion, you make any choices that you would normally make when casting the spell. Whoever drinks the potion is the target of the spell. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic potions.

name: Catch Off-Guard
summary: No penalties for improvised melee weapons

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised melee weapon. Unarmed opponents are flat-footed against any attacks you make with an improvised melee weapon.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You take a –4 penalty on attack rolls made with an improvised weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: Foes are surprised by your skilled use of unorthodox and improvised weapons.

name: Channel Smite
summary: Channel energy through your attack

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Before you make a melee attack roll, you can choose to spend one use of your channel energy ability as a swift action. If you channel positive energy and you hit an undead creature, that creature takes an amount of additional damage equal to the damage dealt by your channel positive energy ability. If you channel negative energy and you hit a living creature, that creature takes an amount of additional damage equal to the damage dealt by your channel negative energy ability. Your target can make a Will save, as normal, to halve this additional damage. If your attack misses, the channel energy ability is still expended with no effect.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can channel your divine energy through a melee weapon you wield.

name: Cleave
summary: Make an additional attack if the first one hits

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the first and also within reach. You can only make one additional attack per round with this feat. When you use this feat, you take a –2 penalty to your Armor Class until your next turn.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can strike two adjacent foes with a single swing.

prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

name: Combat Casting
summary: +4 bonus on concentration checks for casting defensively

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +4 bonus on concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting on the defensive or while grappled.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are adept at spellcasting when threatened or distracted.

name: Combat Expertise
summary: Trade attack bonus for AC bonus

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can choose to take a –1 penalty on melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the dodge bonus increases by +1. You can only choose to use this feat when you declare that you are making an attack or a full-attack action with a melee weapon. The effects of this feat last until your next turn.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can increase your defense at the expense of your accuracy.

name: Combat Reflexes
summary: Make additional attacks of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity per round equal to your Dexterity bonus. With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A character without this feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can't make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.

text.name: Special
text.text: The Combat Reflexes feat does not allow a rogue to use her opportunist ability more than once per round.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make additional attacks of opportunity.

name: Command Undead
summary: Channel energy can be used to control undead

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, you can use one of your uses of channel negative energy to enslave undead within 30 feet. Undead receive a Will save to negate the effect. The DC for this Will save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier. Undead that fail their saves fall under your control, obeying your commands to the best of their ability, as if under the effects of control undead. Intelligent undead receive a new saving throw each day to resist your command. You can control any number of undead, so long as their total Hit Dice do not exceed your cleric level. If you use channel energy in this way, it has no other effect (it does not heal or harm nearby creatures). If an undead creature is under the control of another creature, you must make an opposed Charisma check whenever your orders conflict.

text.name: Info
text.text: Using foul powers of necromancy, you can command undead creatures, making them into your servants.

name: Craft Construct
summary: You can create any construct whose prerequisites you meet.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create any construct whose prerequisites you meet. The act of animating a construct takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its market price. To create a construct, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price, plus the full cost of the basic body created for the construct. Each construct has a special section that summarizes its costs and other prerequisites. A newly created construct has average hit points for its Hit Dice.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create construct creatures like golems.

prereq: Caster level 5th, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Wondrous Item.

name: Craft Magic Arms and Armor
summary: Create magic armors, shields, and weapons

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create magic weapons, armor, or shields. Enhancing a weapon, suit of armor, or shield takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in the price of its magical features. To enhance a weapon, suit of armor, or shield, you must use up raw materials costing half of this total price. The weapon, armor, or shield to be enhanced must be a masterwork item that you provide. Its cost is not included in the above cost. You can also mend a broken magic weapon, suit of armor, or shield if it is one that you could make. Doing so costs half the raw materials and half the time it would take to craft that item in the first place. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic armor, shields, and weapons.

name: Craft Rod
summary: Create magic rods

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create magic rods. Crafting a rod takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a rod, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic rods.

name: Craft Staff
summary: Create magic staves

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create any staff whose prerequisites you meet. Crafting a staff takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a staff, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. A newly created staff has 10 charges. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic staves.

name: Craft Wand
summary: Create magic wands

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create a wand of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know. Crafting a wand takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a wand, you must use up raw materials costing half of this base price. A newly created wand has 50 charges. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic wands.

name: Craft Wondrous Item
summary: Create magic wondrous items

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create a wide variety of magic wondrous items. Crafting a wondrous item takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its price. To create a wondrous item, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. You can also mend a broken wondrous item if it is one that you could make. Doing so costs half the raw materials and half the time it would take to craft that item. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create wondrous items, a type of magic item.

name: Critical Focus
summary: +4 bonus on attack rolls made to confirm critical hits

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +4 circumstance bonus on attack rolls made to confirm critical hits

text.name: Info
text.text: You are trained in the art of causing pain.

name: Critical Mastery
summary: Apply two effects to your critical hits

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you score a critical hit, you can apply the effects of two critical feats in addition to the damage dealt.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit in addition to the damage dealt.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause two additional effects.

prereq: Critical Focus, any two critical feats, 14th-level fighter.

name: Dazzling Display
summary: Intimidate all foes within 30 feet

text.name: Benefit
text.text: While wielding the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus, you can perform a bewildering show of prowess as a full-round action. Make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who can see your display.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your skill with your favored weapon can frighten enemies.

prereq: Weapon Focus, proficiency with the selected weapon.

name: Deadly Aim
summary: Trade ranged attack bonus for damage

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can choose to take a –1 penalty on all ranged attack rolls to gain a +2 bonus on all ranged damage rolls. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2. You must choose to use this feat before making an attack roll and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to touch attacks or effects that do not deal hit point damage.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make exceptionally deadly ranged attacks by pinpointing a foe's weak spot, at the expense of making the attack less likely to succeed.

name: Deadly Stroke
summary: Deal double damage plus 1 Conbleed

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, make a single attack with the weapon for which you have Greater Weapon Focus against a stunned or flat-footed opponent. If you hit, you deal double the normal damage and the target takes 1 point of Constitution bleed (see Conditions). The additional damage and bleed is not multiplied on a critical hit.

text.name: Info
text.text: With a well-placed strike, you can bring a swift and painful end to most foes.

prereq: Dazzling Display, Greater Weapon Focus, Shatter Defenses, Weapon Focus, proficiency with the selected weapon, base attack bonus +11.

name: Deafening Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is deafened

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, the victim is permanently deafened. A successful Fortitude save reduces the deafness to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on deaf creatures. This deafness can be cured by heal, regeneration, remove deafness, or a similar ability.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause enemies to lose their hearing.

name: Deafening Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is deafened

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, the victim is permanently deafened. A successful Fortitude save reduces the deafness to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on deaf creatures. This deafness can be cured by heal, regeneration, remove deafness, or a similar ability.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause enemies to lose their hearing.

name: Deceitful
summary: +2 bonus on Bluff and Disguise checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on all Bluff and Disguise skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at deceiving others, both with the spoken word and with physical disguises.

name: Defensive Combat Training
summary: Use your total Hit Dice as your base attack bonus for CMD

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You treat your total Hit Dice as your base attack bonus when calculating your Combat Maneuver Defense (see Combat).

text.name: Info
text.text: You excel at defending yourself from all manner of combat maneuvers.

name: Deflect Arrows
summary: Avoid one ranged attack per round

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon, you may deflect it so that you take no damage from it. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged attack doesn't count as an action. Unusually massive ranged weapons (such as boulders or ballista bolts) and ranged attacks generated by natural attacks or spell effects can't be deflected.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can knock arrows and other projectiles off course, preventing them from hitting you.

name: Deft Hands
summary: +2 bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

text.name: Info
text.text: You have exceptional manual dexterity.

name: Diehard
summary: Automatically stabilize and remain conscious below 0 hp

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When your hit point total is below 0, but you are not dead, you automatically stabilize. You do not need to make a Constitution check each round to avoid losing additional hit points. You may choose to act as if you were disabled, rather than dying. You must make this decision as soon as you are reduced to negative hit points (even if it isn't your turn). If you do not choose to act as if you were disabled, you immediately fall unconscious. When using this feat, you are staggered. You can take a move action without further injuring yourself, but if you perform any standard action (or any other action deemed as strenuous, including some swift actions, such as casting a quickened spell) you take 1 point of damage after completing the act. If your negative hit points are equal to or greater than your Constitution score, you immediately die.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A character without this feat who is reduced to negative hit points is unconscious and dying.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are especially hard to kill. Not only do your wounds automatically stabilize when grievously injured, but you can remain conscious and continue to act even at death's door.

name: Disruptive
summary: Increases the DC to cast spells adjacent to you

text.name: Benefit
text.text: The DC to cast spells defensively increases by +4 for all enemies that are within your threatened area. This increase to casting spells defensively only applies if you are aware of the enemy's location and are capable of taking an attack of opportunity. If you can only take one attack of opportunity per round and have already used that attack, this increase does not apply.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your training makes it difficult for enemy spellcasters to safely cast spells near you.

name: Dodge
summary: +1 dodge bonus to AC

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You gain a +1 dodge bonus to your AC. A condition that makes you lose your Dex bonus to AC also makes you lose the benefits of this feat.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your training and reflexes allow you to react swiftly to avoid an opponents' attacks.

name: Double Slice
summary: Add your Str bonus to off-hand damage rolls

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Add your Strength bonus to damage rolls made with your off-hand weapon.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You normally add only half of your Strength modifier to damage rolls made with a weapon wielded in your off-hand.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your off-hand weapon while dual-wielding strikes with greater power.

name: Elemental Channel
summary: Channel energy can harm or heal elementals

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of your chosen elemental subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of your elemental subtype, your channel energy has no affect on other creatures. The amount of damage healed or dealt and the DC to halve the damage is otherwise unchanged.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new elemental subtype.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose one elemental subtype, such as air, earth, fire, or water. You can channel your divine energy to harm or heal outsiders that possess your chosen elemental subtype.

name: Empower Spell
summary: Increase spell variables by 50%

text.name: Benefit
text.text: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. An empowered spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can increase the power of your spells, causing them to deal more damage.

name: Empower Spell-Like Ability
summary: Choose one of the creature's spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions below. The creature can use that ability as an empowered spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day).

text.name: Benefit
text.text:

The creature can use that ability as an empowered spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day). When a creature uses an empowered spell-like ability, all variable, numeric effects of the spell-like ability are increased by half (+50%). Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected. text.name: Info
text.text: One of this creature's spell-like abilities is particularly potent and powerful.

prereq: Spell-like ability at caster level 6th or higher.

name: Endurance
summary: +4 bonus on checks to avoid nonlethal damage

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage from exhaustion; Constitution checks made to continue running; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march; Constitution checks made to hold your breath; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from starvation or thirst; Fortitude saves made to avoid nonlethal damage from hot or cold environments; and Fortitude saves made to resist damage from suffocation. You may sleep in light or medium armor without becoming fatigued.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A character without this feat who sleeps in medium or heavier armor is fatigued the next day.

text.name: Info
text.text: Harsh conditions or long exertions do not easily tire you.

name: Enlarge Spell
summary: Double spell range

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to increase its range by 100%. An enlarged spell with a range of close now has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./level, while medium-range spells have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and long-range spells have a range of 800 ft. + 80 ft./level. An enlarged spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level. Spells whose ranges are not defined by distance, as well as spells whose ranges are not close, medium, or long, do not benefit from this feat.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can increase the range of your spells.

name: Eschew Materials
summary: Cast spells without material components

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can cast any spell with a material component costing 1 gp or less without needing that component. The casting of the spell still provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. If the spell requires a material component that costs more than 1 gp, you must have the material component on hand to cast the spell, as normal.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can cast many spells without needing to utilize minor material components.

name: Exhausting Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is exhausted

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you score a critical hit on a foe, your target immediately becomes exhausted. This feat has no effect on exhausted creatures.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess the Critical Mastery feat.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause opponents to become exhausted.

prereq: Critical Focus, Tiring Critical, base attack bonus +15.

name: Exhausting Critical
summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is exhausted

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you score a critical hit on a foe, your target immediately becomes exhausted. This feat has no effect on exhausted creatures.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess the Critical Mastery feat.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your critical hits cause opponents to become exhausted.

prereq: Critical Focus, Tiring Critical, base attack bonus +15.

name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
summary: No penalty on attacks made with one exotic weapon

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You make attack rolls with the weapon normally.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A character who uses a weapon with which he is not proficient takes a –4 penalty on attack rolls.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Exotic Weapon Proficiency multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of exotic weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose one type of exotic weapon, such as the spiked chain or whip. You understand how to use that type of exotic weapon in combat, and can utilize any special tricks or qualities that exotic weapon might allow.

name: Extend Spell
summary: Double spell duration

text.name: Benefit
text.text: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat. An extended spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make your spells last twice as long.

name: Extra Channel
summary: Channel energy two additional times per day

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can channel energy two additional times per day.

text.name: Special
text.text: If a paladin with the ability to channel positive energy takes this feat, she can use lay on hands four additional times a day, but only to channel positive energy.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can channel divine energy more often.

name: Extra Ki
summary: Increase your ki pool by 2 points

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Your ki pool increases by 2.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Extra Ki multiple times. Its effects stack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can use your ki pool more times per day than most.

name: Extra Lay On Hands
summary: Use lay on hands two additional times per day

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can use your lay on hands ability two additional times per day.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Extra Lay On Hands multiple times. Its effects stack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can use your lay on hands ability more often.

name: Extra Mercy
summary: Your lay on hands benefits from one additional mercy

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Select one additional mercy for which you qualify. When you use lay on hands to heal damage to one target, it also receives the additional effects of this mercy.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, select a new mercy.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your lay on hands ability adds an additional mercy.

prereq: Lay on hands class feature, mercy class feature.

name: Extra Performance
summary: Use bardic performance for 6 additional rounds per day

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can use bardic performance for 6 additional rounds per day.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Extra Performance multiple times. Its effects stack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can use your bardic performance ability more often than normal.

name: Extra Rage
summary: Use rage for 6 additional rounds per day

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can rage for 6 additional rounds per day.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Extra Rage multiple times. Its effects stack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can use your rage ability more than normal.

name: Far Shot
summary: Decrease ranged penalties by half

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You only suffer a –1 penalty per full range increment between you and your target when using a ranged weapon.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You suffer a –2 penalty per full range increment between you and your target.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are more accurate at longer ranges.

name: Fleet
summary: Your base speed increases by 5 feet

text.name: Benefit
text.text: While you are wearing light or no armor, your base speed increases by 5 feet. You lose the benefits of this feat if you carry a medium or heavy load.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can take this feat multiple times. The effects stack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are faster than most.

name: Flyby Attack
summary: When flying, the creature can take a move action and another standard action at any point during the move. The creature cannot take a second move action during a round when it makes a flyby attack.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When flying, the creature can take a move action and another standard action at any point during the move. The creature cannot take a second move action during a round when it makes a flyby attack.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, the creature takes a standard action either before or after its move.

text.name: Info
text.text: This creature can make an attack before and after it moves while flying.

name: Forge Ring
summary: Create magic rings.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can create magic rings. Crafting a ring takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a ring, you must use up raw materials costing half of the base price. You can also mend a broken ring if it is one that you could make. Doing so costs half the raw materials and half the time it would take to forge that ring in the first place. See magic item creation rules for more information.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can create magic rings.

name: Gorgon's Fist
summary: Stagger a foe whose speed is reduced

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, make a single unarmed melee attack against a foe whose speed is reduced (such as from Scorpion Style). If the attack hits, you deal damage normally and the target is staggered until the end of your next turn unless it makes a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier). This feat has no effect on targets that are staggered.

text.name: Info
text.text: With one well-placed blow, you leave your target reeling.

prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Scorpion Style, base attack bonus +6.

name: Great Cleave
summary: Make an additional attack after each attack hits

text.name: Benefit
text.text: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the previous foe and also within reach. If you hit, you can continue to make attacks against foes adjacent to the previous foe, so long as they are within your reach. You cannot attack an individual foe more than once during this attack action. When you use this feat, you take a –2 penalty to your Armor Class until your next turn.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can strike many adjacent foes with a single blow.

prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +4.

name: Great Fortitude
summary: +2 on Fortitude saves

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are resistant to poisons, diseases, and other maladies.

name: Greater Bull Rush
summary: Enemies you bull rush provoke attacks of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Bull Rush. Whenever you bull rush an opponent, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).

text.name: Normal
text.text: Creatures moved by bull rush do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your bull rush attacks throw enemies off balance.

prereq: Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

name: Greater Disarm
summary: Disarmed weapons are knocked away from your enemy

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Disarm. Whenever you successfully disarm an opponent, the weapon lands 15 feet away from its previous wielder, in a random direction.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Disarmed weapons and gear land at the feet of the disarmed creature.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can knock weapons far from an enemy's grasp.

prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

name: Greater Feint
summary: Enemies you feint lose their Dex bonus for 1 round

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Whenever you use feint to cause an opponent to lose his Dexterity bonus, he loses that bonus until the beginning of your next turn, in addition to losing his Dexterity bonus against your next attack.

text.name: Normal
text.text: A creature you feint loses its Dexterity bonus against your next attack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at making foes overreact to your attacks.

prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

name: Greater Grapple
summary: Maintain your grapple as a move action

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Grapple. Once you have grappled a creature, maintaining the grapple is a move action. This feat allows you to make two grapple checks each round (to move, harm, or pin your opponent), but you are not required to make two checks. You only need to succeed at one of these checks to maintain the grapple.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Maintaining a grapple is a standard action.

text.name: Info
text.text: Maintaining a grapple is second nature to you.

prereq: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6, Dex 13.

name: Greater Overrun
summary: Enemies you overrun provoke attacks of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Overrun. Whenever you overrun opponents, they provoke attacks of opportunity if they are knocked prone by your overrun.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Creatures knocked prone by your overrun do not provoke an attack of opportunity.

text.name: Info
text.text: Enemies must dive to avoid your dangerous move.

prereq: Improved Overrun, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

name: Greater Penetrating Strike
summary: Your attacks ignore 10 points of damage reduction

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Your attacks made with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 10 points of damage reduction. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/—).

text.name: Info
text.text: Your attacks penetrate the defenses of most foes.

name: Greater Shield Focus
summary: Gain a +1 bonus to your AC when using a shield

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.

prereq: Shield Focus, Shield Proficiency, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.

name: Greater Spell Focus
summary: +1 bonus on save DCs for one school

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose a school of magic to which you have already applied the Spell Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this school are very hard to resist.

name: Greater Spell Penetration
summary: +2 bonus on level checks to beat spell resistance

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance. This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your spells break through spell resistance much more easily than most.

name: Greater Sunder
summary: Damage from sunder attempts transfers to your enemy

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Sunder. Whenever you sunder to destroy a weapon, shield, or suit of armor, any excess damage is applied to the item's wielder. No damage is transferred if you decide to leave the item with 1 hit point.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your devastating strikes cleave through weapons and armor and into their wielders, damaging both item and wielder alike in a single terrific strike.

prereq: Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

name: Greater Trip
summary: Enemies you trip provoke attacks of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Trip. Whenever you successfully trip an opponent, that opponent provokes attacks of opportunity.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Creatures do not provoke attacks of opportunity from being tripped.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make free attacks on foes that you knock down.

prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

name: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting
summary: Gain a third off-hand attack

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a –10 penalty.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are incredibly skilled at fighting with two weapons at the same time.

prereq: Dex 19, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

name: Greater Vital Strike
summary: Deal four times the normal damage on a single attack

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon’s damage dice for the attack four times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make a single attack that deals incredible damage.

prereq: Improved Vital Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +16.

name: Greater Weapon Focus
summary: +1 bonus on attack rolls with one weapon

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus. You are a master at your chosen weapon.

prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.

name: Greater Weapon Specialization
summary: +2 bonus on damage rolls with one weapon

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization feat. Your attacks with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.

prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, Greater Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Specialization with selected weapon, 12th-level fighter.

name: Heighten Spell
summary: Treat spell as a higher level

text.name: Benefit
text.text: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as saving throw DCs and ability to penetrate a lesser globe of invulnerability) are calculated according to the heightened level. The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can cast spells as if they were a higher level.

name: Hover
summary: This creature can hover in place with ease and can kick up clouds of dust and debris.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: A creature with this feat can halt its movement while flying, allowing it to hover without needing to make a Fly skill check. If a creature of size Large or larger with this feat hovers within 20 feet of the ground in an area with lots of loose debris, the draft from its wings creates a hemispherical cloud with a radius of 60 feet. The winds generated can snuff torches, small campfires, exposed lanterns, and other small, open flames of non-magical origin. Clear vision within the cloud is limited to 10 feet. Creatures have concealment at 15 to 20 feet (20% miss chance). At 25 feet or more, creatures have total concealment (50% miss chance, and opponents cannot use sight to locate the creature).

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, a creature must make a Fly skill check to hover and the creature does not create a cloud of debris while hovering.

text.name: Info
text.text: This creature can hover in place with ease and can kick up clouds of dust and debris.

name: Improved Bull Rush
summary: +2 bonus on bull rush attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to bull rush you.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at pushing your foes around.

prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

name: Improved Channel
summary: +2 bonus on channel energy DC

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Add 2 to the DC of saving throws made to resist the effects of your channel energy ability.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your channeled energy is harder to resist.

name: Improved Counterspell
summary: Counterspell with spell of the same school

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When counterspelling, you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, you may counter a spell only with the same spell or with a spell specifically designated as countering the target spell.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at countering the spells of others using similar spells.

name: Improved Critical
summary: Double the threat range of one weapon

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.

text.name: Special
text.text: You can gain Improved Critical multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon. This effect doesn't stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: Attacks made with your chosen weapon are quite deadly.

prereq: Proficiency with weapon, base attack bonus +8

name: Improved Disarm
summary: +2 bonus on disarm attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to disarm you.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at knocking weapons from a foe's grasp.

name: Improved Familiar
summary: Gain a more powerful familiar

text.name: Benefit
text.text:
When choosing a familiar, the creatures listed below are also available to you. You may choose a familiar with an alignment up to one step away on each alignment axis (lawful through chaotic, good through evil).Table: Improved Familiars Familiar Alignment Arcane Spellcaster Level Celestial hawk1 Neutral good 3rd Dire rat Neutral 3rd Fiendish viper2 Neutral evil 3rd Elemental, Small (any type) Neutral 5th Stirge Neutral 5th Homunculus3 Any 7th Imp Lawful evil 7th Mephit (any type) Neutral 7th Pseudodragon 
Neutral good 7th Quasit Chaotic evil 7th 1 Or other celestial animal from the standard familiar list. 2 Or other fiendish animal from the standard familiar list. 3 The master must first create the homunculus. Improved familiars otherwise use the rules for regular familiars, with two exceptions: if the creature's type is something other than animal, its type does not change; and improved familiars do not gain the ability to speak with other creatures of their kind (although many of them already have the ability to communicate).

text.name: Info
text.text: This feat allows you to acquire a powerful familiar, but only when you could normally acquire a new familiar.

prereq: Ability to acquire a new familiar, compatible alignment, sufficiently high level (see below).

name: Improved Feint
summary: Feint as a move action

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Feinting in combat is a standard action.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at fooling your opponents in combat.

name: Improved Grapple
summary: +2 bonus on grapple attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to grapple you.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at grappling opponents.

name: Improved Great Fortitude
summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can draw upon an inner reserve to resist diseases, poisons, and other grievous harm.

name: Improved Initiative
summary: +4 bonus on initiative checks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your quick reflexes allow you to react rapidly to danger.

name: Improved Iron Will
summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your clarity of thought allows you to resist mental attacks.

name: Improved Lightning Reflexes
summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.

text.name: Info
text.text: You have a knack for avoiding danger all around you.

name: Improved Natural Armor
summary: The creature's natural armor bonus increases by +1.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: The creature's natural armor bonus increases by +1.

text.name: Special
text.text: A creature can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the creature takes the feat, its natural armor bonus increases by another point.

text.name: Info
text.text: This creature's hide is tougher than most.

name: Improved Natural Attack
summary: Increase damage from one of a creatures natural attacks by one step.

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Choose one of the creature's natural attack forms (not an unarmed strike). The damage for this natural attack increases by one step on the following list, as if the creature's size had increased by one category. Damage dice increase as follows: 1d2, 1d3, 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 2d6, 3d6, 4d6, 6d6, 8d6, 12d6. A weapon or attack that deals 1d10 points of damage increases as follows: 1d10, 2d8, 3d8, 4d8, 6d8, 8d8, 12d8.

text.name: Info
text.text: Attacks made by one of this creature's natural attacks leave vicious wounds.

name: Improved Overrun
summary: +2 bonus on overrun attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrrun a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to overrun you. Targets of your overrun attempt may not chose to avoid you.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at running down your foes.

prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

name: Improved Precise Shot
summary: No cover or concealment chance on ranged attacks

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Your ranged attacks ignore the AC bonus granted to targets by anything less than total cover, and the miss chance granted to targets by anything less than total concealment. Total cover and total concealment provide their normal benefits against your ranged attacks.

text.name: Normal
text.text: See the normal rules on the effects of cover and concealment in Combat.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your ranged attacks ignore anything but total concealment and cover.

prereq: Dex 19, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +11.

name: Improved Shield Bash
summary: Keep your shield bonus when shield bashing

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield's shield bonus to your AC.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, a character that performs a shield bash loses the shield's shield bonus to AC until his next turn (see Equipment).

text.name: Info
text.text: You can protect yourself with your shield, even if you use it to attack.

name: Improved Sunder
summary: +2 bonus on sunder attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to sunder your gear.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at damaging your foes' weapons and armor.

prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

name: Improved Trip
summary: +2 bonus on trip attempts, no attack of opportunity

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to trip you.

text.name: Normal
text.text: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at sending your opponents to the ground.

name: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
summary: Gain additional off-hand attack

text.name: Benefit
text.text: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a –5 penalty.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at fighting with two weapons.

prereq: Dex 17, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

name: Improved Unarmed Strike
summary: Always considered armed

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed—you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when you attack foes while unarmed. Your unarmed strikes can deal lethal or nonlethal damage, at your choice.

text.name: Normal
text.text: Without this feat, you are considered unarmed when attacking with an unarmed strike, and you can deal only nonlethal damage with such an attack.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are skilled at fighting while unarmed.

name: Improved Vital Strike
summary: Deal three times the normal damage on a single attack

text.name: Benefit
text.text: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon’s damage dice for the attack three times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can make a single attack that deals a large amount of damage.

name: Improvised Weapon Mastery
summary: Make an improvised weapon deadly

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised weapon. Increase the amount of damage dealt by the improvised weapon by one step (for example, 1d4 becomes 1d6) to a maximum of 1d8 (2d6 if the improvised weapon is two-handed). The improvised weapon has a critical threat range of 19–20, with a critical multiplier of ×2.

text.name: Info
text.text: You can turn nearly any object into a deadly weapon, from a razor-sharp chair leg to a sack of flour.

prereq: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +8.

name: Intimidating Prowess
summary: Add Str to Intimidate in addition to Cha

text.name: Benefit
text.text: Add your Strength modifier to Intimidate skill checks in addition to your Charisma modifier.

text.name: Info
text.text: Your physical might is intimidating to others.

name: Iron Will
summary: +2 bonus on Will saves

text.name: Benefit
text.text: You get a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws.

text.name: Info
text.text: You are more resistant to mental effects.

name: Leadership
summary: Gain a cohort and followers

text.name: Benefit
text.text:
This feat enables you to attract a loyal cohort and a number of devoted subordinates who assist you. A cohort is generally an NPC with class levels, while followers are typically lower level NPCs. See Table: Leadership for what level of cohort and how many followers you can recruit. Leadership Modifiers: Several factors can affect your Leadership score, causing it to vary from the base score (character level + Cha modifier). Your reputation (from the point of view of the cohort or follower you are trying to attract) raises or lowers your Leadership score: Other modifiers may apply when you try to attract a cohort, as listed below. Followers have different priorities from cohorts. When you try to attract a follower, use the following modifiers. Leadership Score: Your base Leadership score equals your level plus your Charisma modifier. In order to take into account negative Charisma modifiers, this table allows for very low Leadership scores, but you must still be 7th level or higher in order to gain the Leadership feat. Outside factors can affect your Leadership score, as detailed above. Cohort Level: You can attract a cohort of up to this level. Regardless of your Leadership score, you can only recruit a cohort who is two or more levels lower than yourself. The cohort should be equipped with gear appropriate for its level (see Creating NPCs). A cohort can be of any race or class. The cohort's alignment may not be opposed to your alignment on either the law/chaos or good/evil axis, and you take a –1 penalty to your Leadership score if you recruit a cohort of an alignment different from your own. A cohort does not count as a party member when determining the party's XP. Instead, divide the cohort's level by your level. Multiply this result by the total XP awarded to you, then add that number of experience points to the cohort's total. If a cohort gains enough XP to bring it to a level one lower than your level, the cohort does not gain the new level—its new XP total is 1 less than the amount needed to attain the next level. Number of Followers by Level: You can lead up to the indicated number of characters of each level. Followers are similar to cohorts, except they're generally low-level NPCs. Because they're usually 5 or more levels behind you, they're rarely effective in combat. Followers don't earn experience and thus don't gain levels. When you gain a new level, consult Table: Leadership to determine if you acquire more followers, some of whom may be higher level than the existing followers. Don't consult the table to see if your cohort gains levels, however, because cohorts earn experience on their own.
